meanings.definition: A type of private educational institution in Japan.
meanings.sent1: My cousin attends a juku after school for extra help with his studies.
meanings.sent2: In Japan, many students go to a juku to improve their academic performance.
meanings.sent3: The juku down the street offers specialized classes in math and science.
meanings.sent4: The juku acted as a beacon of knowledge for students seeking academic guidance.
meanings.sent5: The juku was bustling with students eager to learn and grow.

meanings.definition: To attend a juku for extra study.
meanings.sent1: I will juku tonight to prepare for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: She decided to juku on weekends to improve her grades.
meanings.sent3: He jukued diligently to catch up with his classmates.
meanings.sent4: Jukuing late into the night, she finally understood the difficult concept.
meanings.sent5: The students jukued together, supporting each other in their studies.

meanings.definition: A place where students can receive additional tutoring.
meanings.sent1: The school library serves as a juku for students seeking extra help.
meanings.sent2: The community center offers a juku for students struggling with certain subjects.
meanings.sent3: The juku in the park provides tutoring sessions in a relaxed environment.
meanings.sent4: The online juku connected students with tutors from around the world.
meanings.sent5: The juku became a sanctuary for students looking to improve their academic skills.
